Articles.Content:
Hello KSP community , so i decided to get into modding but ran into several problems along the way.

I finally got through them all but one , being the in-game texture being blurred.

Pictures

http://imgur.com/a/OxywH#4excQ

From the look of the pics the stock parts are blurred too ?

Have a look in your KSP settings menu under "Graphics" , try setting your texture quality to - full res .
Doesn't seem to be the problem as it is already at full resolution.

ahh k , well best to start with the basics like game settings

Next thing i can think of is the texture resolution , if its smaller than 512x512 , resize it and see if that fixed it .

Could post a link to the texture you are trying to use ? It would be easier to try and track down whats causing the bleed .

Well the image is 1024 x 1024 so maybe my UV mapping can be causing it?

Here is the part's .Blend file :

http://www./?45f3x4v870pczdx

Well the image is 1024 x 1024 so maybe my UV mapping can be causing it?

http://i.imgur.com/Ked1t.png

Here is the part's .Blend file :

http://www./?45f3x4v870pczdx

Hia , had a play with your texture as it looked a bit low res for a 1024x1024 , may have been the cause of the bleed ..

Try this (hope it works , im not 100%) ((didnt change the filename so be careful not to overwrite yours))

http://img819.imageshack.us/img819/8228/ked1t.png

also a bit new to blender myself .. i think you might have uploaded the wrong file ? .blend2 rather than just the .blend

The blurriness was reduced but is still there and i was able to open the blend2 file with blender.

tank with old next to new texture:

http://imgur.com/pjwxs

Bit stumped then tbh , i did get that blend2 to load but i was given an error message saying something about the model was not 1.0 scale ?

The model wasnt named properly i.e the node_collider and the cylinder needed swapping round..

I cant see anything wrong with the unwrap , but as you can see i get the same blurred effect in blender :/

http://img688.imageshack.us/img688/5025/testank.jpg <--! large picture !

Alright then , the problem is probably the model.

I'll just start from scratch to see if i can get it to work and thanks for the help orson.

anyone else seeing this? I just loaded up .25 for a test run before updating my mods, and the stock 3 man command pod is beyond blurred, but, kerbals, the launch pad, and other assorted things are not blurred. what is going on? ive changed NO settings what so ever from when I last played in .24 to now, and yet, its blurred. yes, im at FULL graphics resolution....

edit:

what in the holy name of Jeb is going on here?!? I just reloaded the game, and things are as they should be.... IF it happens again, ill grab a screen cap, which is, ironically what I was ABOUT to try to do... lol

Edited October 13, 2014 by Higgs
It's possible your UV mapping is off... Maybe you get some stretching, which will reduce the quality of the texture.

It's possible your UV mapping is off... Maybe you get some stretching, which will reduce the quality of the texture.

thats the odd thing, nothing was mishapen by any means, just blurry. a fast restart seems to have fixed it.
you are aware this thread is more than 2 years old right?

anyone else seeing this? I just loaded up .25 for a test run before updating my mods, and the stock 3 man command pod is beyond blurred, but, kerbals, the launch pad, and other assorted things are not blurred. what is going on? ive changed NO settings what so ever from when I last played in .24 to now, and yet, its blurred. yes, im at FULL graphics resolution....

edit:

what in the holy name of Jeb is going on here?!? I just reloaded the game, and things are as they should be.... IF it happens again, ill grab a screen cap, which is, ironically what I was ABOUT to try to do... lol

Holy speaker-eating bungee-jumping Batman! This thread is more than 2 YEARS old! It'd be better if you simply made a new thread in the future (obviously after reading the stickied threads).

...I just reloaded the game, and things are as they should be....

Always check to see if an issue was a one-off, if it can't be reproduced we can't help, also, 2 years old? You crazy, closing!
